goal: Add simple durability to tools and make gathering nodes deplete and respawn so resource usage feels grounded.
decisions: Track durability per tool type (Axe/StoneAxe/Knife/StoneKnife) on the player; decrement on use and break/remove when it hits zero.
Model foraging depletion per tile via a small charge/cooldown pool seeded by biome; trees already use hits, so keep that flow intact.
Keep recipes and inventory unchanged; share durability across copies of the same tool for simplicity.
plan: Add persistence fields for tool durability and per-tile foraging nodes with defaults; seed nodes lazily based on biome.
Apply durability loss on use interactions (forage, chop, knife processing, firewood) and break tools with feedback when exhausted.
Gate foraging by local charges; drain on success, set a cooldown, and respawn after a short delay; add player-facing messages.
Run cargo check and update todo tracking.
notes: No per-item unique durability; durability is tracked per tool type.
Tree chopping already depletes trees; focus depletion on foraging nodes.
progress: Player state now stores tool_durability for axe/stone axe/knife/stone knife; use flows drain durability and break/remove the tool with a pending message at zero.
Foraging nodes are tracked per tile with biome-seeded charges and cooldown-based respawn; depleted tiles block foraging until they recover.
Gather/processing flows apply durability and depletion, with cargo check passing after the changes.
